summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an individual to appear before the grand jury on August 16, 2019, and produce materials related to Jeffrey Epstein and the individual's location and activities on August 9-10, 2019. The subpoena is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: He is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena as part of a grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands an individual to appear before the grand jury to testify and give evidence regarding alleged violations of federal law.

events.title: Time Period of Interest
events.description: The subpoena demands materials establishing the recipient's location and activities between 2 p.m. on August 9, 2019, and 12 p.m. on August 10, 2019.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 12, 2019, for an appearance on August 16, 2019, indicating active federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein in August 2019.
The subpoena demands all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including communications and electronic data.
It specifically seeks evidence of the recipient's location and activities between August 9 and 10, 2019, suggesting this time period is of particular investigative interest.
The subpoena is issued under statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction of evidence), indicating the investigation's potential scope.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, showing high-level DOJ involvement in the Epstein investigation at that time.
